column14: Cattle in same pasture (had not been there previously)

column13: Had been snowing most of night
column33: As time went on, males began moving closer together.

column28: on edge, but caught this morning
won a fight; moving into center of lek; ran off another male

column20: Hens eating, lots of (?) among hens , run off when male approach them (?) left
column33: On 9 Apr 87 there were 3 males on what appears to be the mating center. We caught one night-lighting. 10 Apr 87 from a group of 3 strutting in the moonlight. 1 male trying to force copulations; females beat up on him. R/P P/G standoff. G won encounter.

column20: RW - LW fought off another male before strutting
RW - LW - in center, fought off another
2 Female close to the male which eventually copulates

column33: Auditory evidence of strutting on arrival. 7:13, peregrine falcon landed in center of lek, flushed all birds.
Fight - 6:31, between gg and rr. rr won. Fight - 6:41 between gg + unmarked. Unmarked won. Fight 7:34 between gg + oo. Tie.

column20: All flew off to SW but 1 more
column28: walked around was within 5m of strutting male was unconcerned

column33: 5:49 - everyone slowed down strutting activity. 5:55 G/B standoff. 6:10 P/P fight unmarked male, no clear winner, both (?) and let, 6:12 P/P came back. R/P chased juv across lek. 6:25 - most everyone is feeding (~10 males are strutting). 6:45 juv. On edges strutting quite a bit, adults have about quit.

column27: hen walking by, when hen left most of the strutting quit

column28: feeding, chased juv off, fighting standoff w/ another adult male, other male walked away. 6:43 other male came back, left again 6:46
missing a lot of tail feathers, edge of lek

column13: Wind up, snow up, got nasty!
column14: Rained last night - nitelited last night
Fresh snow on ground - ground cover

column20: 10 hens clustered around 1 male on edge of LEK

column33: Notes: Fight - started by BR (written next to 6:27 - 6:32 time slots in strutting frequency)

column20: B/R ran unmarked male off. 7 birds flew in and landed about 100 yards from lek (not included in count).
Too dark to count, Males strutting vigorously
column33: 3 males w/ hens clustered, all unmarked. 2 centers. 6:43 - fight - standoff B/R and G/W. G/W walked off.

column27: At edge of lek by himself, limping, walking away

column33: had gone to Long lake MSB still there from nightlighting so we came here. G/W is in the mating center, but did not get any copulations, he seems to be in the thick of things.

column20: Females and males started to walk away from LEK

column33: 6:20 copulation: vigorous shaking by female after. 6:10 - three soliciations, 1 female pecked at another that was soliciting. 6:24 soliciation.

column20: 7 females at east, not at centre, therefore total of at least 17 females on lek

column33: Male at east centre with missing tail feathers. 6:41: 1 min into recording another female jumped on back of male, during cop out, didn't disrupt. At 3 1/2 min into count G/W stopped to take flutter at unmarked male. 5:50 W/B last fight to conmarked male at E. mating center. 6:23 broken tail bumped female with airs sacts during strut - she moved 1m for.1 minute before left to N, standing by W/W for 2 minutes. Solicited copulation at 6:15 but then walked off to south. At 6:30 - female was still hanging around W/W at E center. G/W and G/R near N mating center both very vigorous.

column27: cop. During timed period immediately left to fight male about ?m (?) then returned to strut (?)

column33: 1 hen kept soliciting copulations, male was unprepared ~5 times, finally copulated. Standoff - 2 hens, 0.5min, no winner. ~^;24 - one of the bred hens solicited another copulation. 6:31 - B/ standoff w/ /W, B/ walked off. P/B wingbeat w/ unmarked male, (?).

column28: Won a chase w/ an unmarked male, chased him off
